intro: Myrsine cipoensis, commonly known as the Cipo myrsine, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green in color. It produces clusters of small, white flowers that are followed by red, fleshy berries. Myrsine cipoensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
